text: Combray () is a commune in the Calvados department in Normandy in north- western France.Combray sur le site de la communauté de communes Combray is also an imagined village in Marcel Proust's À la recherche du temps perdu (In Search of Lost Time), a book which was strongly inspired by the village of his childhood, Illiers, which has now been renamed Illiers-Combray in his honor. Combray is the title of the first part of the first volume of À la recherche du temps perdu, titled Du côté de chez Swann (Swann's Way). There is a medieval motte-and-bailey castle.Arcisse de Caumont, Statistika monumentalne Calvados ==Population== ==See also== *Marcel Proust *Illiers-Combray ==References== Category:Communes of Calvados (department)
title: Combray
